docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

Phasellus posuere in sem ut cursus

docs.title: Contribute
docs.text: Please refer to our terms of use on doing pull requests.

docs.title: Syntex layout
docs.text: A quick walkthrough on our page making

docs.title: Headers
docs.text:
Headers use the # for doing that for markdown.

Examples:

# Header 1
## Header 2
### Header 3

docs.title: Paragraph
docs.text: Paragraphs don't use the <p> tag. In fact, they are considered texts from that.

docs.title: Code Block
docs.text:
We sometimes use the code blocks for source code or examples.

Example:

Code line

Code block

docs.title: Quotes
docs.text: Doing quotes is sometimes needed for SRC on image files or general text credits

docs.title: Numbering
docs.text: Numbering down sections or listing them is a needed step if doing a tutorial page. Because the bullet points are sometimes needed, they are the same thing, but for different reasons (see below).

docs.title: Points
docs.text: Bullet points usually don't mean anything, but they can infer required things such as cords, devices, and mass storage devices. We may also this for other purposes soon.

docs.title: Tables
docs.text:
Tables are a good idea for sorting and comparing. For a page, it uses the same method for doing the title and layout options. This is hidden, but this example is always visible to the public.

| Column 1 | Column 2 | Column 3 |
| -------- | -------- | -------- |
| Text     | Text     | Text     |

docs.title: Links
docs.text: Links are used for citations (mainly for wikis) to source that section directly. In fact, wikis use that, but we sometimes put references to the table.

docs.title: Other
docs.text: Other styles for paragraphs are not needed, but they can help the reader on what the page is talking about.

docs.title: Bolded
docs.text: Bolded text means that it is an important part you should remember.

docs.title: Italic
docs.text: This type is most likely used for definitions and underlines.

docs.title: Underlines
docs.text: We can do underlines as well in markdown. There is no symbol for that, so we use the <u> tag for that. This section will refer to the bolded part of this page.

docs.title: Strikethrough
docs.text: This one is mainly needed only for the deletion of text that is either misspelled or just not typed out correctly. This is useful for wikis as well.

docs.title: Alerts
docs.text: Alerts are used as a reminder or warning (depending on the section) and is using both Bootstrap and their icons. However, some pages use this as a template and do not use any html inside of the file.

docs.title: Summery
docs.text: In general, the syntax is somewhat complex, and it really is for doing these. These help us save time with writing HTML or other. You can find out the rest we might use on the example page.
